hu.elte.txtuml.api

Annotation Type From


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Documented
public @interface From
    A runtime annotation to define the source vertex of a transition.

    Represents: source property of a transition

    Usage:

    Use on a subclass of StateMachine.Transition and set the value of the value element to reference the representing class of the desired vertex.

    If used on class t with the value referencing class v, the following conditions must be met:

    • t is a subclass of Transition and not Transition itself,
    • v is a subclass of Vertex and not Vertex itself or any subclasses of Vertex defined as nested classes of StateMachine,
    • t and v must be nested classes of the same enclosing class, either a subclass of Region or StateMachine.CompositeState,

      Note: ModelClass is a subclass of Region.

    • neither of t or v is abstract.

    Note: using this annotation on any type except for subclasses of Transition has no effect on the model.

    Example: 

     
  @From(SourceState.class) @To(TargetState.class) @Trigger(SampleSignal.class)
 class SampleTransition extends Transition {}
    See the documentation of StateMachine for detailed examples.

    See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

    Author:
    Gabor Ferenc Kovacs
    See Also:
    StateMachine.Transition, To, Trigger

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends StateMachine.Vertex> value
      The annotation type element to set the source vertex of the transition this annotation is used on.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends StateMachine.Vertex> value
        The annotation type element to set the source vertex of the transition this annotation is used on.
        Returns:
        the class representing the source vertex of the transition
